0.name: Outside the Fortress of Thaumlore
desc: "   You are standing outside the entrance to a large fortress.  The walls
are made from pure obsidian basalt, gleaming like glass, as dark as a
moonless night.  The walls must be at least one hundred feet high, easily
the height of three houses together.  There is a long narrow entryway
through the walls.  Over the near entrance you see two large silver poles
mounted in the ground on either of the entrance.  There is engraving on
each of them.  There does not appear to be any gate upon the entrance,
nor does there appear to be a guard.

1.name: The Fortress Entrance-Way
desc: "   You are in the middle of a long tunnel, stretching about thirty paces
through the walls of the fortress. The roof, walls and floor are all
constructed from smooth black obsidian, the darkness lifted only by the
occasional torch, throwing off a strange white light.  To the east, you
can see a road leading back into the countryside, while the western route
opens out into a courtyard.

2.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing at the entranceway to a long tunnel through the
walls of the fortress.  At the other end of the black, dark, tunnel you
can see a road leading away from the fortress.  Looking around the plaza,
you see a large open space surrounded by dark black glassy walls, with
four three tall towers visible, one in the centre, two at the far corners.

3.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing in the north-eastern corner of the plaza.  From here
all but one of the towers are visible, and the entrance to that one is
beside you.  While the plaza is quite busy with people, most seem to
avoid the corners, near the tower entrances.

4.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are near some doors that lead into the ground floor of the
Fortress.  Many of these doors have signs, indicating their business,
some are shops, some are private homes.  Most doors are closed, though
that apparently does not appear to stop some of the people in the plaza
from passing through them.

5.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing in the north-western corner of the plaza.  From here
all but one of the towers are visible, and the entrance to that one is
beside you.  While the plaza is quite busy with people, most seem to
avoid the corners, near the tower entrances.

6.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are near some doors that lead into the ground floor of the
Fortress.  Many of these doors have signs, indicating their business,
some are shops, some are private homes.  Most doors are closed, though that
apparently does not appear to stop some of the people in the plaza from
passing through them.

7.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing in the south-western corner of the plaza.  From here
all but one of the towers are visible, and the entrance to that one is
beside you.  While the plaza is quite busy with people, most seem to
avoid the corners, near the tower entrances.

8.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are near some doors that lead into the ground floor of the
Fortress.  Many of these doors have signs, indicating their business,
some are shops, some are private homes.  Most doors are closed, though
that apparently does not appear to stop some of the people in the plaza
from passing through them.

9.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing in the south-eastern corner of the plaza.  From here
all but one of the towers are visible, and the entrance to that one is
beside you.  While the plaza is quite busy with people, most seem to
avoid the corners, near the tower entrances.

10.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing in the centre of the great plaza of the Fortress of
Thaumlore.  The plaza is a good two hundred paces in each direction from
the centre. From here, you can see the construction of this fortress.
From each corner, a tall shining tower rises, several stories high.  A
strong statement of white against the sky beyond.  In the centre, right
above your head is another tower, suspended in mid-air.  There's no
visible support, it's just floating there, silently, ominously.
Just where you're standing is a well.  A waft of moist air flows from
the air but there is no mechanism for drawing water.

11.name: At the Base of the North-Eastern Tower
desc: "   You are at the base of a tall tower.  Their is a  winding staircase
spiralling its way up the core of the tower.  You can see from this
vantage point that the stairs go through a floor about thirty yards above
you, and continues beyond that.  Close to where you are standing, there
is an door back to the plaza.  At the base of this tower, you can see
some storage crates and items covered with heavy cloth.
"   You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.

12.name: In the Tower
desc: "   You are on one of the floors in the tower.  You can see some
partitioned sections.  There are hanging drapes covering the entrance to
these sections.  From what you can see, some are shops, others are
working quarters. Above and below you the spiralling staircase passes
through several floors.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.

13.name: In The Tower
desc: "   You are on one of the upper floors of the tower.  From here you can
look out through the windows of the tower.  To the north and east, you
can see large expanses of grass-lands, fields of swaying hay.  In the far
distance east, you can see part of a bay, blue and glinting in the
distance.  From the other windows, you can look down on the crowded plaza,
the people small and busy, scurrying around like ants.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.

14.name: The Tower-Wall Guardroom
desc: "   Standing between two doorways, you can see the fortress walls
stretching to the west and south.  The stairs continues up to the top of
the tower, and down to the floors below.  There is little here at this
level in the tower except some empty racks for weapons and some seats to
sit on.
You climb to the top of the tower, bracing yourself against the
wind.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.

15.name: At the Top of the Tower
desc: "   You are on top of the north-eastern tower.  The top of the tower is
surrounded by battlements carved from the obsidian rock.  There is a
strong gusty wind at this height, pulling at your clothes.  In the centre
of the tower-top, you can see a small pedestal with a glowing cylindrical
object on top.  Apart from the strange object, the other notable feature
is the floating tower in the centre of the plaza, so close now that you
can feel its weight hanging over you, threatening to fall at any time.
You climb down off the roof.

16.name: At the Base of the North-Eastern Tower
desc: "   You are at the base of a tall tower.  Their is a winding staircase
spiralling its way up the core of the tower.  You can see from this
vantage point that the stairs go through a floor about thirty yards above
you, and continues beyond that.  Close to where you are  standing, there
is an door back to the plaza.  At the base of this tower, you can see
some storage crates and items covered with heavy cloth.
"   You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.

You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a

You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a

desc: "   You are on one of the upper floors of the tower.  From here you can
look out through the windows of the tower. To the south and west, you can

From the other windows, you can look down on the crowded plaza, the
people small and busy, scurrying around like ants.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a

You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a

distance, to the east, you can see the glinting nature of a large body of
water with light bouncing off the waves.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a
stop.

You climb to the top of the tower, bracing yourself against the wind.
You climb the stairway, passing several levels, before coming to a

30.name: At the Top of the Tower
desc: "   You are on top of the north-eastern tower.  The top of the tower is
surrounded by battlements carved from the obsidian rock.  There is a
strong gusty wind at this height, pulling at your clothes.  In the centre
of the tower-top, you can see a small pedestal with a glowing cylindrical
object on top.  Apart from the strange object, the other notable feature
is the floating tower in the centre of the plaza, so close now that you
can feel its weight hanging over you, threatening to fall at any time.
You climb down off the roof.

31.name: Standing on the Northern Wall
desc: "   You're standing close to the north-eastern tower, swaying in the
wind.  The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden
trellises has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

32.name: Standing on the Northern Wall
desc: "   You're standing between the two northern-most towers, swaying in the
wind.  The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden
trellises has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

33.name: Standing on the Northern Wall
desc: "   You're standing close to the north-western tower, swaying in the wind.
The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden trellises
has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

34.name: Standing on the Western Wall
desc: "   You're standing close to the north-western tower, swaying in the wind.
The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden trellises
has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

35.name: Standing on the Western Wall
desc: "   You're standing between the two western-most towers, swaying in the
wind.  The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden
trellises has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

36.name: Standing on the Western Wall
desc: "   You're standing close to the south-western tower, swaying in the wind.
The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden trellises
has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

37.name: Standing on the Southern Wall
desc: "   You're standing close to the south-western tower, swaying in the wind.
The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden trellises
has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

38.name: Standing on the Southern Wall
desc: "   You're standing between the two southern-most towers, swaying in the
wind.  The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden
trellises has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

39.name: Standing on the Southern Wall
desc: "   You're standing close to the south-eastern tower, swaying in the wind.
The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden trellises
has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

40.name: Standing on the Eastern Wall
desc: "   You're standing close to the south-eastern tower, swaying in the wind.
The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden trellises
has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

41.name: Standing on the Eastern Wall
desc: "   You're standing between the two eastern-most towers, swaying in the
wind.  The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden
trellises has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

42.name: Standing on the Eastern Wall
desc: "   You're standing close to the north-eastern tower, swaying in the wind.
The fortress walls are glassy and smooth, but a path of wooden trellises
has been laid to ensure good footing for those on the wall.

43.name: Just Below the Central Spire
desc: "   You are standing in open air, right beneath the central tower.  From
here you have a great view of the plaza below, but it is a precarious
position to be watching it from, nothing beneath you but fifty feet of
air and a deep dark well.  Looking up there is a wooden hatch that may
lead into the tower.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, secret, pickproof, knockable, hidden, autoclose, autolock

44.name: At the Base of the Central Spire
desc: "   You are at the base of the central spire.  There is a stairway
leading to the levels above.  This tower does not seem to be furnished
any differently to the other towers and is apparently constructed the
same, though the foundations are fifty feet of air.  There is a large
wooden hatch in the centre of the floor.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, knockable, autoclose, autolock

45.name: Central Spire
desc: "   You are in the central spire of the Fortress of Thaumlore, while it
is not apparently constructed for defence, it is definitely imposing, and
the windows here provide a clear line of view of the surrounding region.
There is a stairs leading both up and down to the other floors in the
tower. There is also a partitioned section to this floor which appears to
be an equipment store.

46.name: Central Spire
desc: "   You are on one of the upper floors of the tower. There are a lot of
well decorated and ostentatiously rich accommodations on this level.
There are also a few shops here for the more advanced wizards and
magicians.  Most are closed, or with no apparent entrance.  The stairs
leading above indicates that it is the residence of the Guildmaster, and
that he is not to be disturbed without an appointment or good reason,
actually it says
|        Fire and lightning and the Proving grounds below        |
|          for he, she or it who bothers me for no good          |
|                            reason!                             |

47.name: Central Spire
desc: "   You are in the guildmaster's quarters.  It is well appointed with
rich furnishings, a long velvet-covered couch, an oak table, a roaring
fire and a pair of comfortable chairs.  The walls are covered in
tapestries depicting the battles of wizard and dragon-kin.  There is a
sense of age and wisdom in the room.  There is an exit leading via the
central stairway back down the tower to the levels below.
A glowing portal appears, and as you step through, you feel
transported a long distance, before being deposited at your
destination.

48.name: Amulets and Wands
desc: "   This is the home for the more advanced magical artefacts that exist
in Arandia.  There are amulets, wands, and little objects that seems to
be mutate into different shapes before your very eyes.  There is an elven
lady working in the back of the room.  She appears to be the guardian of
these artefacts.

49.name: Mid-Air, Above the Plaza
desc: "   You are about halfway between the plaza and the tower above. It feels
like a strange place to be, and it is not likely that you'll be able to
stay for long.  The well beneath you appears dark, deep and foreboding.

50.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are at the end of a corridor.  There appears to be a small
structure at the end of the corridor. It is shaped in the wall and it
leaves just enough room for a small statue.  On either side of the stone
stand there are two mounted torches, burning with a strange white light
and no smoke.  There is a gentle breeze blowing from the end of the
corridor, but there does not seem to be any source for it.

51.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

52.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

53.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

54.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

55.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are at the end of a corridor.  There appears to be a small
structure at the end of the corridor. It is shaped in the wall and it
leaves just enough room for a small statue of a perfect mountain.  On
either side of the stone stand there are two mounted torches, burning
with a strange white light and no smoke.  There is a gentle breeze
blowing from the end of the corridor, but there does not seem to be
any source for it. There is something strange about that statue...
55.flags: dark, no_mob, no_sum, private, fast_moves, relocate_distort

56.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are at the end of a corridor.  There is a gentle breeze blowing
from the end of the corridor, but there does not seem to be any source
for it. At this end of the corridor, the bones are piled up high, all dry,
fragile, pieces of cloth intermixed with ribs, leg and arm bones.

57.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are at the end of a corridor.  There appears to be a small
structure at the end of the corridor. It is shaped in the wall and it
leaves just enough room for a small statue of a perfect mountain.  On
either side of the stone stand there are two mounted torches, burning
with a strange white light and no smoke.  There is a gentle breeze
blowing from the end of the corridor, but there does not seem to be
any source for it. There is something strange about that statue...
57.flags: dark, no_mob, no_sum, private, evil_altar, good_altar, neutral_altar

58.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

59.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

60.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the maze. Corridors lead off in
many directions and there appears to be little difference between them.
The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little
light, just sufficient to highlight the darkness.  There is the sound of
movement coming from several of the corridors

61.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the maze. Corridors lead off in
many directions and there appears to be little difference between them.
The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little
light, just sufficient to  highlight the darkness.  There is the sound
of movement coming from several of the corridors

desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the maze. Corridors lead off in

The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little

63.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the maze. Corridors lead off in
many directions and there appears to be little difference between them.
The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little

64.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

65.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the Proving Grounds of the Keep.
There are corridors leading off in many directions and there appears to
be little difference between them.  The air is still, the occasional
torch mounted in the walls give little light, just enough to add a dark
mood to the corridors with their flickering.  Above you is a long
corridor leading to a light far above, a well, continuing beneath you
to the water below.  The lip around the well is very narrow, requiring
the most delicate of balance.
65.flags: dark, no_mob, no_sum, private, fall, relocate_distort

66.name: The Gateway to Mount Celestia
desc: "   You are standing on a smooth stone bridge.  Before you, to the north,
rises a mountain higher than any you have ever seen in your life.  It's
majesty takes your breath away.  The bridge continues north, over a deep
blue sea of sparkling water, leading you towards the base of the mountain.
This can only be Mount Celestia.  And if so, you are on another plane.  Be
careful, brave adventurer, for even in the lands of Good and Law dangers
exist that could obliterate your soul.
Congratulations! You have discovered the entry site to a new zone that is
currently in the process of being designed, built and tested. Watch that
MOTD for a release date :)

67.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are at the end of a corridor.  There is a gentle breeze blowing
from the end of the corridor, but there does not seem to be any source
for it. At this end of the corridor, the bones are piled up high, all
dry, fragile, pieces of cloth intermixed with ribs, leg and arm bones.

The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little
light, just sufficient to highlight the darkness.  There is the sound of
movement coming from several of the corridors

73.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

74.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the maze. Corridors lead off in
many directions and there appears to be little difference between them.
The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little
light, just sufficient to highlight the darkness.  There is the sound of
movement coming from several of the corridors

75.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the maze. Corridors lead off in
many directions and there appears to be little difference between them.
The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little
light, just sufficient to highlight the darkness.  There is the sound of
movement coming from several of the corridors

77.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange

been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot

78.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,

been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

79.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

80.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are at the end of a corridor.  There is a gentle breeze blowing
from the end of the corridor, but there does not seem to be any source
for it. At this end of the corridor, the bones are piled up high, all
dry, fragile, pieces of cloth intermixed with ribs, leg and arm bones.

81.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are at the end of a corridor.  There appears to be a small
structure at the end of the corridor. It is shaped in the wall and it
leaves just enough room for a small statue of a perfect mountain.  On
either side of the stone stand there are two mounted torches, burning
with a strange white light and no smoke.  There is a gentle breeze
blowing from the end of the corridor, but there does not seem to be
any source for it. There is something strange about that statue...
81.flags: dark, no_mob, no_sum, private, indoors, fast_mana

82.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

83.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the maze. Corridors lead off in
many directions and there appears to be little difference between them.
The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little
light, just sufficient to highlight the darkness.  There is the sound of
movement coming from several of the corridors

84.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are in a dark corridor.  The walls of the corridors have strange
sigils engraved.  In the flickering candle light from the wall mountings,
you can see that these symbols are suggestive of magical runes and have
been smoothed by age.  There is a small gentle breeze but you cannot
identify the location.

85.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are at the end of a corridor.  There appears to be a small
structure at the end of the corridor. It is shaped in the wall and it
leaves just enough room for a small statue of a perfect mountain.  On
either side of the stone stand there are two mounted torches, burning
with a strange white light and no smoke.  There is a gentle breeze
blowing from the end of the corridor, but there does not seem to be
any source for it. There is something strange about that statue...

86.name: Falling Down through the Well
desc: "   You are at the top of the well.  You can see from here the full
expanse of the courtyard.  Beneath you is a deep deep well.  You cannot
see the bottom.  Around the lip of the well you can see some runes
engraved with golden letters.  You sense a strange tickling across your
skin.
86.flags: dark, no_mob, no_sum, no_magic, private, fall, dispel_magic

87.name: Falling Down through the Well
desc: "   You are in a dark well, the light above seems distant, the ground
beneath invisible but for a reflection off some water.

88.name: Falling Down through the Well
desc: "   You are in a dark well, the light above seems distant, the ground
beneath invisible but for a reflection off some water.

89.name: Falling Down through the Well
desc: "   You are in a dark well, the light above seems distant, the ground
beneath invisible but for a reflection off some water.

90.name: Falling Down through the Well
desc: "   You are in a dark well, the light above seems distant, the ground
beneath invisible but for a reflection off some water.

91.name: Beneath the Surface of the Water
desc: "   You are just beneath the water's surface in the well. The walls here
are covered in slimy algae, giving little purchase to help you climb out.

92.name: At the Bottom of a Well
desc: "   You are at the bottom of a dark well.  The pressure of the water
presses down, compressing your lungs, squeezing your ideas back into
their eye-cavities. All around, on the floor of the well, you can see
rusty armour and rotting bones, piled deep.  There is no floor actually,
just a platform of broken bones, weapons and armour.

93.name: Teleport Room (right room)
desc: "   A strange tingling travels over your skin!

95.name: Potions and Scrolls
desc: "   What a wonderful shop, brimming to the rafters with shelves of
potions and stacks of scrolls.  There is a  faint smell of elderberry in
the air, sweetly scented if a little cloying.  At the back of the shop
you see a large desk where the proprietor is to be found.

96.name: The Alchemist's Dream
desc: "   This is a store that caters for the needs of every alchemist.
Mortars and pestles, pots and pans, herbs and essences.  There are also a
pile of scrolls in the back, wrapped in a golden ribbon. At the back of
the shop is a complex combination of pipes, tubes, bottles and furnaces,
gurgling away, filling bottles with some strange concoction.
96.flags: no_mob, indoors, peaceful, no_sum, no_magic, private

97.name: Leather Games
desc: "   You are in a shop filled with leather.  Some of it is plain brown
leather, but most has been treated and polished to a lustrous gleam, red
and black in colour.  There is a cloth covered section towards the back
which seems a  little more exclusive than the rest, with clear signs that
it has been warded against unwelcome guests. What remains seems dedicated
to more standard armours and daily wear.

98.name: The Thaumlore Armoury
desc: "   You are in the Armoury of the Fortress.  There are racks upon racks
of weapons, staffs, robes, armour.  There are glowing balls of energy
stacked against the wall, glowing rods of energy.  The place literally
hums with deadly power. There is a desk with a collection of guards and
the  armoury master.  They carefully monitor all who enter, and are
currently monitoring you.

99.name: The Challenge Room
desc: "   You are in a large room, wider than the tower could possibly
accomodate.  The walls are made from the same black obsidian, the floor
smooth but with good grip. There is a light from the central point of the
ceiling providing good illumination.  The entrance you came through has
changed and now a simple door remains. A sign over the door simply says,

extra.desc: "  Leaving is a sign of weakness, come back when you're more competent.

100.name: The Torment Proving Grounds
desc: "   You are standing at a crossroads in the maze. Corridors lead off in
many directions and there appears to be little difference between them.
The air is still, the occasional torch mounted in the walls give little
light, just sufficient to highlight the darkness.  There is the sound of
movement coming from several of the corridors
